intro: Alloneuron dorrii, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Alloneuron dorrii is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats.
